creator: Tesai Hokuba
title: Five Beauties
label: The two women on the left play a hand-gesture game called kitsune-ken (fox fists) in which gestures representing a supernatural fox (kitsune) defeat those of a village head (shōya), who defeats a hunter (ryōshi), who in turn defeats the fox. An apprentice courtesan serves tea while a high-ranking courtesan makes a grand entrance. A feast of sashimi and other delicacies sits nearby.
medium: hanging scroll; ink and color on silk
subject: Women

creator: Dorothea Lange
title: Japanese American-owned grocery store, Oakland, California (National Gallery of Art)
label: Oakland, Calif., Mar. 1942. A large sign reading 'I am an American' placed in the window of a store, at [401 - 403 Eighth] and Franklin streets, on December 8, the day after Pearl Harbor. The store was closed following orders to persons of Japanese descent to evacuate from certain West Coast areas. The owner, a University of California graduate, will be housed with hundreds of evacuees in War Relocation Authority centers for the duration of the war.
subject: Japanese Americans, Forced Removal and Internment, Wartime Civil Control Administration

creator: Vincent van Gogh
title: The Bedroom
label: This moment marked the first time the artist had a home of his own, and he had immediately and enthusiastically set about decorating, painting a suite of canvases to fill the walls. Completely exhausted from the effort, he spent two-and-a-half days in bed and was then inspired to create a painting of his bedroom.
subject: Bedroom

creator: Unknown Artist
title: The Earthquake of 1855 (Ansei 2), Japan
label: The Earthquake of 1855 (Ansei 2), 230 Years since the Great Kantô Earthquake of 1627 (Kan'ei 4) and 153 Years since the Great Earthquake of 1703 (Genroku 16), 11th month, 22nd day
medium: woodblock print; ink and color on paper
subject: Earthquake

creator: Joan Miró
title: The Farm
label: These puzzling pictograms of daily life on Joan Miró’s family farm in Montroig, Spain, invite us into a magical world.
currentLocation: National Gallery of Art (Washington D.C., USA)
subject: Farmhouse, Animals, Crops

creator: Michel Anguierd
title: The Flood
label: This relief is a sketch-model for one of the series of thirteen stucco reliefs, intended as models for marbles but never subsequently executed, of Old and New Testament scenes.
subject: Flood

creator: Tsubasa Kato
title: The Lighthouses - 11.3 PROJECT
label: Using the large amount of wood collected over six months, we created a structure modeled on the Shioyazaki Lighthouse, a symbol of the area that also lost its lights due to the earthquake.
subject: Tsunami, Lighthouse, Reconstruction
